Description: Fragment body of Attic red-figured pottery small closed vase, probably a squat lekythos. The left shoulder, neck, and chin of a figure to left in a himation remains.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 105 no. 371 pl. 79)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1934)
